website_summaries.verdict: With its ability to effortlessly suck up to 70 pints of moisture out of the air per day, 24-hour programmable timer, and ambient temperature sensors for the level of room humidity you need, this is the best option for treating bigger areas for moisture and mold.
cons: This dehumidifier is a fairly expensive model, but a necessary purchase for treating large rooms

customer_reviews.title: Pump Outlet Strategy
customer_reviews.text: You have to use leverage, as the other reviewer mentioned, to insert that tube all the way into the pump outlet. Otherwise it will leak. Get in front of the unit and pull the tube into the outlet at least 15 mm.
customer_reviews.author: John M. McGuinness

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and poor customer service.
customer_reviews.text: This unit worked well for 2 months. After 2 months, an "EC" error occurs after 2 minutes of running. Completely unreliable and nonexistent customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn A. Timmons

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what was needed!
customer_reviews.text: This unit replaces a two year old whirlpool. Not sure why there’s so many negative comments regarding the drain hose for the pump. You’ve got to be smarter than the device you’re using! This thing has been rock solid so far. It’s more quiet than the unit it’s replacing and functions flawlessly, keeping the humidity at a constant 35%. Very well built.
customer_reviews.author: Rob S.

customer_reviews.title: Loud but great at removing moisture
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Its working really well keeping the humidity down in my basement. Followed the other reviews when installing the drain tube which made it easy. Only thing i dont like is i have not found a working solution to routing the drain tube to my utility sink which is over 20 ft away so i have to use 5gallon bucket with the drain tube draining the water into it then carry the bucket to the sink. Lastly, the machine is quite loud.
customer_reviews.author: K. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Our windows were having heavy condensation and did not want ...
customer_reviews.text: Our windows were having heavy condensation and did not want to spend money on storm windows or other option. After some research on condensation thought we would give this a try. Work perfectly!! This is a house we are fixing up to sell, so this is even more important. We use the drain constantly since no one lives there. With homeowners they could empty the container each day as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the basement at the perfect level. This particular dehumidifier was recommended by a ...
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Keeps the basement at the perfect level. This particular dehumidifier was recommended by a friend and I'm very glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: WeHaLady

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: The pump only works if you have a sink in the basement to drain it into. It does not accommodate a hose long enough to go out a window. None of this is clear from the product description on the website. And The hose fittings leak on this item because there's a cheap plastic fitting instead of a brass fitting to attach a hose to. Also the instructions are confusing and don't explain how the system works or have good diagrams of how to attach the hoses, etc. it does seem to be relatively quiet, but other than that I'm rather disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Linda j. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Really like the Danby with internal pump.
customer_reviews.text: Like many comments, a little difficult to get the drain pump hose fully inserted. Instruction manual could have been more helpful for this particular model. My prior Danby worked perfectly for 8 years. No other models I have tried lasted more than a couple of years. Based on the reliability of the earlier Danby I felt compelled to stay with this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Huban

customer_reviews.title: Danby makes the BEST. Dont waste money on other brands!
customer_reviews.text: We have had only Danby humidifiers over the last 10 years, running two at a time in our large basement. After trying other brands, Danby makes the best, quietest, most efficient and safest humidifier. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Jane Brownback

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: unless there is a trick to it the upward pump will not work. I have tried everything it says to do in the manual. I am very disappointed cause that's why I bought this model.
customer_reviews.author: Nan Arato

customer_reviews.title: It's made my basement a happier place.
customer_reviews.text: I have had a dehumidifier in the basement for years but this one is so much better - and we fed it's drain water into the drain for the washing machine because it has the efficient little pump - it runs whenever it needs to and I no longer have to empty a heavy water cannister daily. Very nice features and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia Hamel

customer_reviews.title: Quiet
customer_reviews.text: I have only had it for 2 months, It is quiet. My only complaint is the downspout always falls down. You have to be very gentle when putting the waste water receptacle back in.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua G.

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and does the job
customer_reviews.text: Great for my basement. Bigger than expected and runs quietly. Setup was a breeze and the fan runs strong out the side of the unit. Emptying it daily is part of my routine.
customer_reviews.author: Ricke Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Took on Harvey Damage
customer_reviews.text: Great dehumidifier. My nephew’ home was flooded during Hurricane Harvey in Houston so I got this for him. Works wonderfully. So much humidity and water damage that he runs it 24/7 and boy what a difference. Great machine!
customer_reviews.author: PBAT26

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, works well, time saver pumping water up to a sink
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure if I should buy after reading some reviews, but knowing some issues helped me set it up to pump water up to a sink in the basement and it went well. As mentioned tank stays full of water so it needs to be dumped and cleaned to prevent mold in tank. Overall works well, cycles off and on as needed depending on the humidity setting, I like not dumping the tank twice a day. Fairly quiet unit, I would buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Rwgems

customer_reviews.title: excellent dehumidifier
customer_reviews.text: We have been plagued by an unusually wet spring and summer. I purchased two of these units and the basement no longer smells musty. You barely hear them running. I have one set up for auto empty into the utility sink and have not had any problems with it. The other gets emptied a couple of times per week. They work well.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Good product for humidity control
customer_reviews.text: I use this at work in the print room. It keeps the paper from having the "humidity wrinkles" which cause jams in the printer. It also pulls enough moisture out of a temperature controlled room, with no exit to the outside, to fill the dispenser every day.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine I

customer_reviews.title: Works after 1 year. Worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: Works wonderfully. I purchased for my bathroom and to help with overall humidity by the gulf coast. It is loud. Not super loud but noticeable if you are within 10 feet
customer_reviews.author: Aly

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works very well in a combination laundry room / grow room.
customer_reviews.author: User is the User

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: A little noisy and the reserve water bin is too small.
customer_reviews.author: Peter DeRosa

customer_reviews.title: Will this work?
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased this to replace a comparable unit from Fridigaire that died 11 months after purchase. We'll see if this one lasts! It does have a two year warranty without additional purchase. It set up very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Literally stopped working within four hours of plugging it in. Sent it back and ordered a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Built-in pump doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: This dehumidifies the space just fine, but the continuous drain function doesn't work at all. The connection for the hose has no mechanism to secure it, so you stick the hose in and hope for the best, which in our case was a leaky connection and gallons of water on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Katawomba

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine used at a dirt cheap price but in like new condition. There was a problem with the compressor not turning off so the bucket would over fill. I also found a second problem where it would frost up in my basement and never defrost. I replaced a couple of parts for a total of $20 and now it runs like new. This thing is quiet, defrosts within minutes and moves two buckets of water every 24 hours. I have not tried the pump but soon I will just hook a hose up for continual draining. It's also slick looking.
customer_reviews.author: Derek S. Sutherland

product_meta.title: Danby Energy Star 70-Pint Dehumidifier Vertical Pump
product_meta.description: Danby 70-Pint portable dehumidifier is equipped with a built-in vertical pump that allows the unit to pump water upward directly into a sink or out a basement window for continuous operation. This energy efficient unit operates quietly on 2 fan speeds (high/low) in rooms up to 4,500 square feet. It has a smart dehumidifying function that allows the unit to automatically control humidity by factoring in ambient room temperature. If the unit shuts off unexpectedly due to a power outage, it will automatically restart with the previous function settings when power is restored. The automatic de-icing system ensures the coils are always ice-free while the low temperature feature allows the system to continue to operate at temperatures as low as 41F. Maintenance is easy with the removable air filter and direct-drain system. Plus, Danby 70-Pint dehumidifier has four built-in caster wheels making it easy and convenient to move the unit from one room to another.
feature_bullets: Portable dehumidifier removes up to 70 pints of moisture from the air per day
Vertical pump can pump water upward directly into a sink or out a basement window for continuous operation
For use in rooms up to 4,500 sq. Ft. Depending upon conditions
Front access water tank with 12.7-Pint capacity and full-tank indicator light
